tuv.seg: European elections - alternative voting arrangements
Toghcháin Eorpacha - socruithe eile vótála
The following people may vote by post in a European Parliament election:
Is féidir leis na daoine seo a leanas vóta a chaitheamh tríd an bpost i dtoghchán do Pharlaimint na hEorpa:
• Members of An Garda Siochana
• Baill den Gharda Síochana
• Members of the Defence Forces
• Baill na bhFórsaí Cosanta
• Civil servants and their spouses attached to Irish missions abroad
• Státseirbhísigh agus a gcéilí atá ag obair le misin Éireannacha thar lear
• Electors living at home who are unable to vote at a polling station due to a physical illness or disability
• Vótálaithe a chónaíonn sa bhaile ach nach bhfuil in ann vóta a chaitheamh ag na stáisiúin vótála de bharr tinnis nó míchumais fhisiciúil
• Full-time students registered at home who are living elsewhere while attending an educational institution in the State
• Mic léinn lánaimseartha atá cláraithe le vótáil sa bhaile ach a chónaíonn in áit eile le freastal a dhéanamh ar institiúid oideachais sa Stát
• Prisoners detained as a result of an order of a court
• Príosúnaigh coinnithe de thoradh ordú cúirte
To vote by post, a ballot paper will be posted to you at your home
Más mian leat vóta a chaitheamh tríd an bpost ní mór go mbeadh páipéar ballóide curtha chugat sa phost chuig do bhaile
You must arrange to have a declaration of identity witnessed by a Garda before marking the ballot paper in the Garda station and returning it by post to the returning officer
Ní mór duit socrú a dhéanamh go mbeadh dearbhú aitheantais sínithe ag Garda roimh an bpáipéar ballóide a mharcáil ag stáisiún na nGardaí agus é a chur ar ais sa phost chuig an gceann comhairimh
Special voting arrangements apply to electors living in hospitals, nursing homes or similar institutions who are unable to vote due to a physical illness or disability
Baineann socruithe speisialta le daoine a chónaíonn in ospidéil, i dtithe altranais nó institiúidí eile den chineál nach féidir leo vóta a chaitheamh de bharr tinnis nó míchumais fhisiciúil
The ballot paper is brought to them in the institution and they vote in the presence of a special presiding officer accompanied by a Garda
Tugtar an páipéar ballóide chucu san institiúid agus caitheann siad a vóta i láthair oifigigh speisialta i gceannais agus Garda
Electors with physical disabilities who have difficulty in gaining access to their local polling station may be allowed to vote at a more accessible station in the constituency

Aon duine a bhfuil míchumas fisiciúil air/uirthi a bhíonn deacracht aige/aici dul isteach chuig an ionad vótála áitiúil beidh cead aige/aici a vóta a chaitheamh ag ionad níos feiliúnaí dó/dí sa toghcheantar céanna
There is more information on european elections on the website of the Department of Housing, Planning, Community and Local Government
Tá tuilleadh eolais maidir le toghcháin na hEorpa ar láithreán gréasáin na Roinne Tithíochta, Pleanála​​, Pobail agus Rialtais Áitiúil
